thread.title: The iconic Nokia 3310 making a comeback later this month alongside new Android smartphones
thread.title_full: The iconic Nokia 3310 making a comeback later this month alongside new Android smartphones

title: The iconic Nokia 3310 making a comeback later this month alongside new Android smartphones
text:
The iconic Nokia 3310 making a comeback later this month alongside new... The iconic Nokia 3310 making a comeback later this month alongside new Android smartphones By - February 14, 2017 “HMD will launch a modern version of the much-loved and nearly indestructible Nokia 3310 at MWC” 
The iconic, nearly indestructible and immensely popular Nokia 3310 will be making a comeback later this month at MWC. Yes…. you read it right. HMD Global, the new home of Nokia devices, is reportedly planning to relaunch the much-loved Nokia 3310, which was originally launched in the year 2000. Apart from the feature phone, HMD Global will also be launching two entry-level Nokia-branded Android smartphones at its pre-MWC event on February 26th in Barcelona. 
VentureBeat’s Evan Blass aka @ evleaks suggests that HMD Global will launch a modern version of the Nokia 3310. The classic workhorse was popular for its plentiful battery life, nearly indestructible build and addictive Snake video game. The source claims that the device will be priced at €59 (Rs 4,200). With this competitive pricing, it will be able to win over nostalgic Nokia fans, for use as a second phone. 
Coming to the new Nokia Android smartphones, the report claims that the company will launch the Android Nougat-powered Nokia 5 and Nokia 3 at MWC. The Nokia 5 is expected to feature a 5.2-inch HD display, 2GB of RAM and a 12MP rear snapper, and will be priced at €199 (approx. Rs 14,000). The Nokia 3 will be a more affordable offering at €149 (around Rs 10,500). We will be attending MWC to bring you all the official details this month, watch this space for more.
